poem:
Title: Props of Fading Stardom

Stolen tokens of timeless tales –
Spectacles, one lightsaber pale.
Memories wrapped in gossamer threads,
Captured in ceramic and royal reds.
Once they danced on silver screen,
Now bartered, bodies not yet seen.
Bittersweet this changing hue,
Last curtain's call, a final coup:
Dreams in dust, yet still they gleam,
The echoes of a waking dream.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Succession coffee mugs and dresses from The Crown: hit TV shows sell off prized props Celebrities are notorious for taking props from sets to keep as personal momentos. Daniel Radcliffe has admitted to taking several pairs of Harry Potter’s spectacles, while Adam Driver took home a lightsaber when filming wrapped on Star Wars. However, this could soon be a thing of the past as props from many of our most-loved TV shows are going up". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
